lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Light.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Light.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.

* Represents the main class of the Light program.
* @param filePath The file path of the storage file.
* The main method of the Light program.
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Adds the task to the task list and updates the storage file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n" +
"\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a command to be executed.
* @throws LightException if an error occurs during execution
abstract public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LightException;
* Returns true if the command is an exit command.
* @return true if the command is an exit command
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* @param taskNumber The number of the task to be deleted.
* Deletes the task from the task list and updates the storage file.
* @throws LightException if an error occurs during execution
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LightException {
ui.showMessage("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + tasks.get(taskNumber) + "\nNow you have " + (tasks.size() - 1) + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a command to exit the program.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents a command to find tasks in the task list.
* Creates a new FindCommand with the given keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* Executes the command to find tasks in the task list.
* @param tasks   The task list to find tasks from.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage to save the task list to.
* @throws LightException If an error occurs while finding tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LightException {
* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task list.
* Lists all tasks in the task list.
* @throws LightException if an error occurs during execution
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LightException {
* Represents a command to mark a task as done or undone.
* @param taskNumber The number of the task to be marked.
* @param isMark     True if the task is to be marked as done, false if it is to be marked as undone.
* Marks the task as done or undone and updates the storage file.
* @throws LightException if an error occurs during execution
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LightException {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + tasks.get(taskNumber));
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as undone:\n" + tasks.get(taskNumber));

* @param e The exception containing the error message to be displayed.
* @param message The message to be displayed.
* Reads the command entered by the user.
* @return The command entered by the user.
* Represents an exception specific to the Light application.
public Deadline(String description, String by) throws LightException {
this.by = Parser.dateTimeParser(by, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("[d/MM/yyyy HHmm][MMM d yyyy HHmm]"));
public Event(String description, String start, String end) throws LightException {
this.start = Parser.dateTimeParser(start, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("[d/MM/yyyy HHmm][MMM d yyyy HHmm]"));
this.end = Parser.dateTimeParser(end, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("[d/MM/yyyy HHmm][MMM d yyyy HHmm]"));
return "[E]" + super.toString() + "(from: " + start.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy HHmm")) + " to: " + end.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy HHmm")) + ")";
throw new LightException("Description cannot be empty");
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
